awd_titl_txt: COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH: Crustal Profile of a Major          Transpressional Boundary: Tectonic Evolution of the         Norumbega Fault Zone, Maine
awd_abstract_narration: The Norumbega Fault Zone in Maine is a major feature                       long considered to be a dextral strike-slip fault system.                       Preliminary observations suggest however that the NE-SW                         striking fault zone represents a partial crustal profile of                     a major transcurrent boundary, with significantly different                     crustal levels exposed along strike.  This project is aimed                     at taking advantage of this feature to characterize the                         styles of metamorphism and deformation processes with                           increasing depth in the crust.  It will employ detailed                         mapping, petrology and Ar/Ar geochronology to constrain                         timing of deformation events, along four areas or transects                     along strike.  Results will elucidate the tectonic                              significance of this fault zone in the development of the                       Appalachian orogen.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
